place.name: RHIWLEN
place.gazetteerText: RHULEN, a parish in the district of Builth and county of Radnor; on the river Edwy, 6½ miles E by S of Builth r. station. Post-town, Kington. Acres, 756. Real property, £673. Pop., 111. Houses, 19. The property is much subdivided. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Glascomb, in the diocese of St. Davids. The church is tolerable. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
